a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Change in income inequality: Gini coefficient, 1963 to 2021
The Gini coefficient measures inequality on a scale from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate higher inequality.
Depending on the country and year, the data relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to
Data source: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2023)
Note: Income and consumption estimates are available separately in this Data Explorer.
